subject: Re: Possible bug with @Ignore @BeforeClass?
msgSnippet: ... Yes, I udnerstand these things quite clearly. My situation is that I have an expensive fixture to set up, so I need to set it up once for all tests (I
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "ginkgo_w" <ginkgo_w@...> wrote:

> Maybe it is a bug, But I think it is your understanding is wrong.
> @BeforeClass is like the junit3 TestSetup class.
> @Before is like setUp

Yes, I udnerstand these things quite clearly.

My situation is that I have an expensive fixture to set up, so I need
to set it up once for all tests (I know, I know... but its a fairly
bulky disk hierarchy...) I am also using the tests to learn how
certain libraries manipulate the data, so sometimes I want to be able
to /keep/ all the stuff on disk so that I can go and examine it after
the tests have run.

Anyway, I've found a (probably better) way around the problem.
